thread.title: Whole Foods Market, Qualys Tumble On Weak Sales, Guidance
thread.title_full: Whole Foods Market, Qualys Tumble On Weak Sales, Guidance

title: Whole Foods Market, Qualys Tumble On Weak Sales, Guidance
text:
Whole Foods Market Closing Stores After Weak Sales, Guidance; Qualys Dives Whole Foods Market reported weaker-than-expected sales and guidance after the market close Wednesday. (Whole Foods) 
Whole Foods Market ( WFM ) and cybersecurity firm Qualys ( QLYS ) reported earnings after the closing bell, with both reporting lighter-than-expected sales and guidance. Whole Foods Market 
Estimates: Whole Foods Market is expected to report a 14% EPS decline to 39 cents, which would be its third straight year-over-year decline. Fiscal Q1 sales should climb 3% to $4.979 billion. 
Results: Q1 EPS of 39 cents excluding a variety of items. Sales edged up nearly 2% to $4.9 billion. Same-store sales fell 2.4%, their sixth straight decline. 
Outlook: Whole Foods sees fiscal 2017 EPS of $1.33 or greater, with sales growth of 1.5% or more. Analysts had expected EPS of $1.44 and stronger sales gains. The grocer now sees same-store sales down as much as 2.5% this fiscal year, with comps in the current quarter down 3.2% so far. 
Whole Foods plans to close nine locations in the current quarter, something it hasn't done since 2008, during the severe recession. It will still open six locations 
Stock: Shares fell more than 6% in early after-hours action, but pared losses to about 2%. Whole Foods closed up 1.1% to 29.30 on the stock market today . 
Whole Foods Market stock has been in a long-term decline. The organic and natural foods grocer pioneer has struggled with high prices as competitors proliferate, including pure-play Sprouts Farmers Market ( SFM ) and mainline grocer Kroger ( KR ). Qualys 
Estimates: Qualys is expected to report a 14% EPS decline to 18 cents, with sales up 18% to $52.62 million. 
Results: Qualys earned 23 cents, with sales of $52.2 million. 
Outlook: Qualys sees Q1 EPS of 17-19 cents with sales of $52 million to $53 million. Analysts expected EPS of 21 cents and sales of $54.48 million. For the full-year, Qualys predicts EPS of 81-86 cents and revenue of $224 million to $228 million. Wall Street had been looking for EPS of 91 cents and revenue of $233.51 million. 
Stock: Shares fell nearly 8% in late trade. The stock had closed up 0.3% to 36.85 after rising intraday above a 37.10 buy point in a cup-with-handle base. Shares peaked above that entry on Feb. 3, but pulled back on Monday. 
Cybersecurity stocks were hot for much of 2016, but have slumped. Fortinet ( FTNT ), Check Point Software ( CHKP ) and Symantec ( SYMC ) reported strong results in recent weeks, but FireEye ( FEYE ) plunged on its quarterly figures.
